pages.text: The process of $(thing)Refractory Burning$() is identical to that of $(thing)Pit Burning$() with the exception that the material used to surround the burning ingredients must be a valid refractory material.$(p)$(warning) Familiarize yourself with how a $(thing)Pit Burn$() works before attempting a $(thing)Refractory Burn$().
The $(item)Refractory Door$() is a valid refractory block when it is placed flush against the burning ingredients.
$(item)Refractory Glass$() is a valid refractory block even though it is transparent.
$(item)Refractory Collector$() is a valid refractory block.$(p)$(info) This collector can hold hot fluids, such as lava.
$(item)Refractory Drain$() is a valid refractory block.$(p)$(info) This drain can hold hot fluids, such as lava.
